schemes.title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
schemes.description: A crop insurance scheme that aims to reduce the premium burden on farmers and ensure early settlement of crop assurance claims for the full insured sum.
eligibility: All farmers including sharecroppers and tenant farmers growing notified crops in notified areas
Compulsory for farmers availing crop loans for notified crops
benefits: Insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in the event of crop failure
Stabilizing the income of farmers to ensure their continuance in farming
Encouraging farmers to adopt innovative and modern agricultural practices
applicationProcess: Approach the nearest bank branch or insurance company
Fill the application form and submit required documents

schemes.title: PM Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana
schemes.description: Income support scheme that provides direct cash transfers to farmers' bank accounts to supplement their financial needs.
eligibility: All landholding farmers' families with cultivable land
Subject to exclusion criteria based on higher income status
benefits: Direct income support of Rs. 6,000 per year in three equal installments
Helps farmers meet farm input costs and household expenses
applicationProcess: Register online at PM-KISAN portal or through Common Service Centers

schemes.title: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
schemes.description: Provides farmers with affordable credit for their agricultural needs through a simplified procedure.
eligibility: All farmers, tenant farmers, oral lessees, and sharecroppers
benefits: Access to short-term loans for cultivation at subsidized interest rates
Coverage for post-harvest expenses and marketing costs
No collateral required for loans up to Rs. 1.6 lakh
applicationProcess: Apply at nearest bank branch or through online banking portal
Receive KCC and start utilizing credit

schemes.title: Soil Health Card Scheme
schemes.description: A scheme to issue soil health cards to farmers containing crop-wise recommendations for nutrients and fertilizers to help farmers improve productivity through judicious use of inputs.
benefits: Recommendations for appropriate dosage of nutrients
Improvement in soil health and crop yield
applicationProcess: Contact local agriculture department or Krishi Vigyan Kendra
Receive soil health card with recommendations

schemes.title: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY)
schemes.description: A scheme to ensure access to irrigation to all agricultural farms to produce 'per drop more crop' and improve water use efficiency.
eligibility: All farmers with focus on small and marginal farmers
Priority to drought-prone and water-scarce areas
benefits: Precision irrigation and other water-saving technologies

schemes.title: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)
schemes.description: Promotes sustainable agriculture through climate change adaptation measures, water use efficiency, soil health management, and resource conservation.
eligibility: All farmers with focus on areas with degraded soil
Farmers in rainfed and drought-prone areas
benefits: Support for organic farming and soil health management
Assistance for water harvesting and management
applicationProcess: Apply through local agriculture department or Krishi Vigyan Kendra
Submit proposal for sustainable agriculture practices

schemes.title: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
schemes.description: Promotes organic farming through adoption of organic village model approach and Participatory Guarantee System (PGS) certification.
eligibility: All farmers willing to adopt organic farming
Preference to farmers in groups of 50 or more
applicationProcess: Form a group of at least 20 farmers
Implement organic practices and get PGS certification

schemes.title: National Food Security Mission (NFSM)
schemes.description: Aims to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals, and commercial crops through area expansion and productivity enhancement.
eligibility: Focus on small and marginal farmers
applicationProcess: Register for specific components of the mission

schemes.title: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)
schemes.description: Promotes holistic growth of horticulture sector including fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, and aromatic plants.
benefits: Support for area expansion under horticulture crops

schemes.title: Agricultural Technology Management Agency (ATMA)
schemes.description: Focuses on agricultural extension reforms to make the extension system farmer-driven and farmer-accountable through new institutional arrangements.
eligibility: All farmers interested in adopting new technologies
benefits: Exposure visits to successful farming models

schemes.title: Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization (SMAM)
schemes.description: Promotes agricultural mechanization among small and marginal farmers and in areas with low farm power availability.
benefits: Financial assistance for purchasing agricultural machinery
applicationProcess: Submit proposal for machinery purchase or custom hiring center

schemes.title: National Livestock Mission (NLM)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying
schemes.description: Ensures quantitative and qualitative improvement in livestock production systems and capacity building of all stakeholders.
benefits: Support for breed development and farm management
applicationProcess: Apply through district animal husbandry department

schemes.title: Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme (DEDS)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying
schemes.description: Promotes setting up of modern dairy farms, infrastructure for milk processing, and value addition through bankable projects.
benefits: Back-ended capital subsidy for dairy farm establishment
Support for purchase of milking machines and equipment
Assistance for dairy product manufacturing units
Cold storage facilities for milk products
applicationProcess: Apply through local NABARD office or bank

schemes.title: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maan Dhan Yojana (PM-KMY)
schemes.description: Provides pension to small and marginal farmers after they attain the age of 60 years.
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers aged between 18-40 years
Not covered under any other statutory social security scheme
benefits: Monthly pension of Rs. 3,000 after reaching 60 years of age
Family pension to spouse in case of death of the farmer
Return of contribution with interest in case of death before 60 years
applicationProcess: Register at nearest Common Service Center (CSC)
Fill the application form and submit required documents
Make regular contributions as per age

schemes.title: Micro Irrigation Fund (MIF)
schemes.description: Facilitates states in mobilizing resources for expanding coverage of micro irrigation systems by taking up special and innovative projects.
eligibility: State governments implementing micro irrigation projects
Indirectly benefits farmers adopting micro irrigation
applicationProcess: State governments submit proposals to NABARD
Farmers apply through state agriculture department

schemes.title: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
schemes.description: Provides medium to long-term debt financing for investment in viable projects for post-harvest management infrastructure and community farming assets.
benefits: Interest subvention of 3% per annum for loans up to Rs. 2 crore
Credit guarantee coverage under CGTMSE for loans up to Rs. 2 crore
Financing for warehouses, cold chains, and processing units
Moratorium for loan repayment aligned to project cash flow
applicationProcess: Submit project proposal to financing institutions

schemes.title: PM Formalization of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (PMFME)
schemes.description: Provides financial, technical, and business support for upgradation of existing micro food processing enterprises.
benefits: Credit-linked capital subsidy at 35% of eligible project cost
applicationProcess: Apply through state nodal agency or district resource person

schemes.title: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)
schemes.description: Ensures holistic development of agriculture and allied sectors by allowing states to choose their own agriculture and allied sector development activities.
eligibility: State governments (who then implement for farmers)
Indirectly benefits all farmers in the state
benefits: Flexibility to states for local needs
applicationProcess: State governments submit State Agriculture Plans
Farmers apply through state agriculture department for specific components

schemes.title: National Bamboo Mission (NBM)
schemes.description: Promotes holistic growth of bamboo sector by adopting area-based, regionally differentiated strategy and to increase the area under bamboo cultivation and marketing.
eligibility: Farmers with suitable land for bamboo cultivation
applicationProcess: Apply through state forest department or agriculture department
Submit proposal for bamboo plantation or processing unit

schemes.title: Maharashtra State Rural Livelihood Mission (MSRLM)
schemes.description: Aims to reduce poverty by enabling the poor households to access gainful self-employment and skilled wage employment opportunities.
eligibility: Farmers with focus on small and marginal
benefits: Market linkages for products and services
applicationProcess: Join or form a self-help group in the village
Apply for financial assistance through MSRLM
